subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Update on intelligent Senior QS Font.
msgSnippet: I also looked into font creation and found the same thing. Most of the abilities built into the current font format are not supported by most programs. What I
messageBody:
I also looked into font creation and found the same
thing. Most of the abilities built into the current
font format are not supported by most programs.

What I thought would help in a new QS font most, would
be better "kerning" and letter shape. Between the two
of them I think we could get a font that would connect
well and look good.

Once we can get to that level other fonts from that
base could be make.

Chuck

--- fctarbox3 <rtarbox@...> wrote:
> Just because it's the kind of gearhead I am, I've
> been researching
> what I suggested before -- a font that would
> automatically produce
> Senior QS while the user types as if writing Junior
> QS.
>
> It turns out that I'm at the leading edge of font
> design. While the
> OpenType font standard does support this kind of
> thing, currently
> very few applications support all the properties of
> an OpenType font.
>
> (
>
http://www.myfonts.com/info/opentype-support-in-applications/
> )
>
> The upshot is that the only applications that would
> consistently
> display an OpenType QuickScript (OTQS?) font as
> designed are Adobe
> InDesign or Adobe PhotoShop.
>
> There are various shenanigans that I might pull to
> make Microsoft
> Word also display an OTQS properly, but ultimately I
> am very
> disappointed in these people. :P
>
> Older font types, such as TrueType, still seem to me
> to have the
> possibility for this kind of scripting, but making
> it actually work
> is beyond me.
>
>
>

I also looked into font creation and found the same
thing. Most of the abilities built into the current
font format are not supported by most programs.

What I thought would help in a new QS font most, would
be better "kerning" and letter shape. Between the two
of them I think we could get a font that would connect
well and look good.

Once we can get to that level other fonts from that
base could be make.

Chuck
